name: Calculus I
description: This course introduces students to the fundamentals of differential calculus and its applications. Students will learn about limits, continuity, derivatives, and integrals.

name: Calculus II
description: This course expands on the fundamentals of differential calculus and introduces students to integral calculus. Students will learn about techniques of integration, applications of integration, polar coordinates, and sequences and series.

name: Physics I
description: This course introduces students to the principles of classical mechanics. Students will learn about kinematics, Newton's laws, work, energy, momentum, rotational motion, oscillations, and waves.

name: Physics II
description: This course expands on the principles of classical mechanics and introduces students to the principles of electricity and magnetism. Students will learn about electric charge, electric field, electric potential, capacitors, magnetic field, electromagnetic induction, and alternating current circuits.

name: Introduction to Nuclear Engineering
description: This course introduces students to the principles of nuclear engineering. Students will learn about nuclear reactions, fission, fusion, radioactivity, radiation, radiation detection, radiation shielding, and nuclear power.

name: Differential Equations
description: This course introduces students to the principles of differential equations and its applications. Students will learn about first-order differential equations, second-order differential equations, Laplace transforms, and systems of differential equations.

name: Nuclear Reactor Theory
description: This course introduces students to nuclear reactor theory. Students will learn about reactor kinetics, neutron diffusion theory, one-group and multi-group diffusion, criticality, and reactor control.

name: Thermal Hydraulics of Nuclear Reactors
description: This course introduces students to the thermal hydraulics of nuclear reactors. Students will learn about fluid mechanics, heat transfer, two-phase flow, heat transfer in two-phase flow, and thermal-hydraulic behavior of nuclear reactors.

name: Materials in Nuclear Engineering
description: This course introduces students to materials used in nuclear engineering. Students will learn about material behavior, selection of materials, and materials for radiation protection.

name: Nuclear Fuel Cycle
description: This course introduces students to the nuclear fuel cycle. Students will learn about uranium resources, nuclear fuel enrichment, fuel fabrication, fuel irradiation, and spent fuel storage and disposal.

name: Nuclear Reactor Safety
description: This course introduces students to nuclear reactor safety. Students will learn about the principles of reactor safety, reactor accidents, containment systems, emergency planning, and risk assessment.
